Name: Street Masters: Aftershock
Description:
Ransom City is no more. What was once a thriving metropolis, turned crime-ridden warzone, is now little more than rubble. A missile strike from an unknown origin preceded the Aftershock—which is what the aftermath came to be known as. Almost half the city was wiped out by the missile, those that survived emerged from the destruction to be greeted by VANDAL fumes; a chemical-based mutagen that had various effects on its subjects.

The government has been massively destabilized due to the Kingdom’s nefarious activities, and the survivors of Ransom City are left to fend for themselves in their hostile new home. Criminals re-emerged to claim dominance over the remaining resources, while the pharmaceutical giant Parasol Incorporated publicly announced their intention to lead cleanup efforts in Ransom City.

Unfortunately, the corporation's interests seem skewed, and since their arrival many things have gotten worse. Including the arrival of strange mutated lab experiments and what could only be described as monsters straight out of horror movies…

Aftershock is a deluxe expansion for the Street Masters board game, adding four new fighter decks, four new stage decks, two new enemy decks, new loot cards, and much more! Expanding on the modular nature of Street Masters, Aftershock includes two new ways to customize your play experience: missions and showdowns.

The mission deck is included to speed up multiplayer games by adding additional ways to support your fellow fighters. Mission cards allow fighters to gain powerful mission tokens, that can in turn be used to assist your fellow fighters during their turn.

Showdowns are a new type of story deck that can be used in any story mode game, adding a villainous character working in the shadows against the fighters. Each showdown deck introduces a unique story for the associated enemy deck, as well as upgrade cards that will truly test the fighters! Players can also choose to include these enemy upgrade cards in their arcade games to increase difficulty and customize their games even further.

Additionally, Aftershock comes packed in a massive storage box that is designed to hold all existing Street Masters decks and tokens, as well as room for future content.

-description from designer

Name: Unemployment
Description: In this roll-and-move game, each player is attempting to either become the first player to get a job or to be the last player to go bankrupt. On each player's turn they roll the die and move their pawn around the board. Depending on which space they land on, they will most likely draw a card, which will either give them additional qualifications to get a job, interview advice, or contacts. A player can use these cards to move into the Interview Space, and with a little luck and the right cards, the player can win the game. Similarly, players will also collect "Mail" cards during the game, which are bills they must pay periodically. Thus, a player may end up going bankrupt due to their bills before they have a chance to find a job.

Name: Taco vs. Burrito: Foodie Expansion Pack
Description:
New ingredients and more surprises for Taco vs. Burrito.

Contains:
16 Foodie Ingredient Cards
14 Action Cards
2 Instruction Cards

Name: Grand Manoeuvre Napoleonic Wargames Rules: Solo Module
Description:
The Solo Module is designed to slowly reveal an automated plan of battle for the non-player side. The rules determine the command decisions of enemy, non-player generals. They may also be used to automate the decisions of subordinate commanders in one to one game play; adding to uncertainty and unpredictability in “normal” games.

The first three sections of the module will generate the non-player’s dispositions, orders and battle arrays if the game has been generated by a campaign, or if it is a fictitious battle. Alternatively, if you wish to re-fight a particular battle, you can keep the historical dispositions and go straight to section two and then section three and possibly change the “shape” and events of the battle by varying the non-players` corps orders and consequently also their battle arrays.

The non-player will react in response to your grand-tactical movements or to changes in tactical situation. There is also a section which relates to the delegation of orders applying to minor objectives. Section eight, “Tactical Systems, Dispositions and Divisional Battle Arrays” is reproduced here from Grand Manoeuvre Miniatures Wargames Rules to provide solo players with more useful information on battle arrays, methods and unit formations used by various nations throughout the Napoleonic period.

Section nine is optional and allows for chance events that may occur in and around the battlefield area that may affect player’s and non-player’s decisions.

The module has 106 pages. The text is spaciously laid out and the rules mechanisms are very simple.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Grand Manoeuvre Rules Updates for 1811-1851
Description:
This rules update for 1811-1851 is for players who already have Grand Manoeuvre`s original Napoleonic war games rule set. For those that do not, please see Grand Manoeuvre Nineteenth Century Wargames Rules Variants (1811-1851). Grand Manoeuvre`s Rules Updates for 1811-1851 cover the following wars:

1. The South American Wars 1811-1824.
2. The November Uprising 1830-1.
3. The Egyptian–Ottoman Wars 1831–3 & 1839-41.
4. The Mexican War of 1846-8.
5. The First Italian War of Independence 1848-9.
6. The Hungarian Uprising 1848-9.
7. The 1st Schleswig-Holstein War 1848-51.

The set includes the following: A rules introduction booklet, which explains the game basics and historical terms. The introduction includes rules amendments for each war, units` and generals` ratings. Rules amendments notes for each war listed above. These have notes on; tactical doctrine, unit qualities, leadership and where appropriate the weapons used by each side and their effects on the rules. Orders and messages sheets, Unit/A.D.C. number labels, and order cards are playing aids to make player`s order writing easier.

-description from publisher's website
Families: History: Latin American Wars of Independence
Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Grand Manoeuvre Nineteenth Century Wargames Rules Variants (1811-1851)
Description:
Grand Manoeuvre`s Rules for 1811-1851 cover the following wars:

1. The South American Wars 1811-1824.
2. The November Uprising 1830-1.
3. The Egyptian–Ottoman Wars 1831–3 & 1839-41.
4. The Mexican War of 1846-8.
5. The First Italian War of Independence 1848-9.
6. The Hungarian Uprising 1848-9.
7. The 1st Schleswig-Holstein War 1848-51.

The set includes the following: A rules introduction booklet, which explains the game basics and historical terms. The introduction includes rules amendments for each war, units` and generals` ratings. The main rules booklet, which has the main games rules in sequence of play. A black and white copy of the main rules booklet, a copy to save on printer ink! A quick reference 8 page mini-booklet, which has most of the main rules. Rules amendments notes for each war listed above. These have notes on; tactical doctrine, unit qualities, leadership and where appropriate the weapons used by each side and their effects on the rules. Orders and messages sheets, Unit/A.D.C. number labels, and order cards are playing aids to make player`s order writing easier.

Note: for gamers who already have the original Napoleonic rule set, they would just need Grand Manoeuvre Rules Updates for 1811-1851

-description from publisher's website
Families: History: Latin American Wars of Independence

Name: Tiny Tanks
Description:
Tiny Tanks is a fast-paced, clever little shooter to get your game night started – you’ll have a blast! Matches are fast - only a couple minutes each. And it's quick to reset! We recommend playing 4 or 5 matches in a sitting as warmup on game night!

Players control a tank moving across a field. There are three main actions: Move, Action Card, and Shoot. Each has their own straightforward rules to follow.

The goal is to strategically approach an opponent tank (which often involves putting yourself in danger) and destroying it! The simple mechanic makes for fast paced appetizer-style gameplay. The Action Cards blend simple instructions with humor and style.

—description from the designer

Name: Warhammer 40,000: Kill Team – Rogue Trader
Description:
Rogue Trader Elucia Vhane and her Starstriders seek to colonise new worlds at the behest of the Imperium’s mightiest leader. Their quest aims to travel far beyond the Chaos contamination that threatens to engulf Mankind. Yet nowhere is safe, for the twisted tendrils of corruption have followed them even beyond the borders of the Imperium. Can the Rogue Trader and the deadly specialists she has forged into a team defeat the hulking Vulgar Thrice-Cursed and his virulent band of mutated followers? Can the cutting edge of human skill match the loathsome gifts granted by the Dark Gods?

Kill Team: Rogue Trader is an expansion for Warhammer 40,000: Kill Team, the fast-paced tabletop miniatures game pitting small bands of elite specialists against each other in vicious skirmish combat. This set adds 2 new factions, new environments, new missions and a host of new rules, allowing you to recreate desperate battles beyond the borders of known space.

Contents include:
Kill Team: Rogue Trader - 56-page book filled with background and rules for the Elucidian Starstriders and Gellerpox Infected – as well as new advanced rules for all Kill Team factions.

Codex: Elucidian Starstriders - 24-page booklet.

Codex: Gellerpox Infected - 24-page booklet.

The 16-page Warhammer 40,000 Core Rules, explaining everything you need to play to play Warhammer 40,000. Moving, shooting, using psychic powers, charging, fighting and morale tests are covered, giving you the basic framework to play with.

33 plastic multi-part Citadel miniatures (10x Elucidian Starstriders; 23x Gellerpox Infected)

A selection of plastic scenery:
- 10 bulkhead doors;
- 4 chests featuring the crest of Elucia Vhane;
- 2 sections of pipework;
- 4 command consoles;
- 4 escape pods;
- 2 chairs.

A double-sided gameboard, featuring the layout of the Truehawk on one side and the Ministorum shrine on the other. This measures 22”x30”, exactly the same as the board found in Kill Team – with which this board can be combined to create a large play area that can accommodate up to 4-player games!

2 sets of punched card tokens representing various in-game statuses – 1 set for the Starstriders and 1 set for the Infected.

Name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: "Nok-Nok" Promo Character Card Set
Description:
This year's Free RPG Day promo character for Pathfinder Adventure Card Game is the goblin Nok-Nok. You can play Nok-Nok with any Pathfinder Adventure Card Game set, including Rise of the Runelords, Skull & Shackles, Wrath of the Righteous, or Mummy's Mask.

Nok-Nok's character card (and role and token cards) work just like the others in the Pathfinder Adventure Card Game."

Pack includes:

     Free RPG Day card
     Token card
     Nok-Nok character card (Male Goblin Thief)
     Role card - Head Drum/Tha Fith Gawd


-description from publisher's website
Families: Series: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game (Paizo Publishing)

Name: World War I Game
Description: This is part of the Learningames History Series. In it, you learn about World War I and the battles that were fought. There are three levels of play included in the rules; Basic Game, Identify the Location of the Event, and Identify the Event Based on the Location. The winner of the game is the player with the most cards.

Name: Arena Deathmatch (Third Edition)
Description:
Avatars of War: Arena DeathMatch is a 28mm miniatures game that depicts the bloody clash between two or more bands of heroes facing off on the floor of the arena, in front of a raucous crowd that is thirsty for action, violence and death. This deadly contest is known as a deathmatch.

The most powerful heroes among the mortal races are known as Avatars of War--heroes chosen by the Gods of War themselves. These Avatars, in addition to being fierce combatants, are able to draw upon the silver of divinity within their souls for the power to expand their already awesome combat abilities.

In Arena DeathMatch, each player controls a band of Avatars of War as they face off on the arena floor in front of a cheering (or jeering) crowd.

The perils of the Arena stand against you: traps, hazards and even savage beasts stand between you and your opponent. The door to the Arena opens, and the shouting crowd is eager to see their favourite heroes fight to the death. Will they be cheering your victory...or your death? There's only one way to find out!

DIFFERENCES IN SECOND EDITION (2011) VERSUS FIRST ONE

The second edition is the result of compiling all the feedback from players and review and refine the first edition rules accordingly, resulting in a  smooth and streamlined set of rules that deliever plenty of action and strategy. In Arena Deathmatch 2nd. ed  you can customize your fighters and game tactics to new levels, choosing from more than 500 different options for their weapons, armor, feats, abilities and spells.   The potential combinations and strategies with the new ruleset are almost limitless.

DIFFERENCES IN THIRD EDITION (2016) VERSUS SECOND ONE

The 100% new thing in 3rd are Combat combos: A combat combo consists of performing a succession of combat actions to carry out extremely powerful attacks. Look for the symbol § to know which actions are comboable.
After successfully executing a comboable action, the Avatar can immediately (without the enemy being able to act) perform another action (comboable or not). The combo will end when a non-comboable action is performed, or when performing an action without success (by mistake or by the opponent's counter).

COMBATE GLADIATORIO FANTÁSTICO

Arena Deathmatch es un juego de combate de miniaturas.
En Arena Deathmatch cada jugador crea y dirige una banda de Avatares de la Guerra y la enfrenta a la banda de otro jugador en la arena, bajo la mirada de la muchedumbre, sedienta de acción, sangre y violencia.

El desenlace de una partida de Arena Deathmatch empieza a escribirse mucho antes de saltar al combate, al reclutar y adiestrar a tus campeones de la arena.
Una vez en la arena, deberás poner a prueba tu capacidad para pensar rápido, usar tácticas astutas y utilizar los puntos fuertes de tus luchadores para atacar los puntos débiles de los luchadores de tu oponente.

Pero tu contrincante no es el único obstáculo hacia la victoria, los peligros de la arena son un reto por sí solos: pozos de muerte y bestias salvajes se ciernen sobre tu banda.

Finalmente, no subestimes la importancia de agradar a tus seguidores ¡Tener a la multitud a tu lado marcará a menudo la diferencia entre la victoria y la derrota!

Name: Crabs Adjust Humidity: Volume Seven (fan expansion for Cards Against Humanity)
Description:
From the publisher:

Volume Seven of the unofficial 3rd-party expansion to the hit party game Cards Against Humanity.

Here at VSC, we needed to take some time off to really figure some stuff out. It was like, one day we were working away at our desks and it just hit us all at once: what have we even been doing here, man? Like, does it really mean anything, you know?

Within days we were backpacking into the mountains of Costa Rica, where we met a man named Raúl. The weeks we spent with Raúl changed us in ways we can’t even begin to describe. When we emerged from the jungle, we brought with us two things: a newly reborn sexual identity and Crabs Adjust Humidity: Volume Seven.

Raúl spoke no English, but by the glow of firelight he taught us things that opened our chakras and brought forth another deck of 112 cards so ethically lacking, they’ve truly earned the name Crabs Adjust Humidity.
Includes: 80 white cards, 32 black cards
Part of a complete breakfast.
For recreational use only.
 —description from the publisher

Name: Naja
Description:
Naja is a genus of venomous snakes known as cobras, and in ancient Egypt they indicated sovereignty, royalty, and even divinity. The gods themselves are depicted crowned with a naja.

The scarab rolls the sun around to rise each day, and thus ensures renewal and prosperity. As royalty, veritable deities, you send your najas to lay claim to scarabs, ensuring new life for your lineage.

In the game Naja, players take turns placing cobras on the board trying to surround as many scarabs as possible. But try not to claim bonfires, lest they harm your najas and weaken your reign!

EQUIPMENT

This is what you need to play Naja:


     9x9 board with a scarab on each cell
     20 white najas (snakes)
     20 black najas (snakes)
     7 bonfires
     40 black baskets
     40 white baskets


You can also get the expansion for 3–4 players:


     15 gray najas
     15 purple najas
     30 gray baskets
     30 purple baskets


SETUP

Place the board in the middle of the playing surface. Each player takes all najas and counters of her colour.

Randomly place 5 or 7 bonfires (not 6) on different spaces of the board, except for the middle space (to avoid symmetric play) and the border spaces (where they pose almost no risk).

HOW TO PLAY

White starts. Players take turns in clockwise order legally placing a naja of their colour until no legal placement remains, at which point the game ends.

Najas have 4 segments. Each naja must be placed so that:


     All four segments lie on 4 segments of the board.
     They don’t overlap.


GAME END

The game ends when no more placements are possible.

Players then claim areas as follows: The player with more naja segments surrounding an enclosed area must claim it by placing a basket of her colour on each space in the area (except for areas with bonfires on them). If two (or more) players tie in claiming an area, it remains unclaimed. The edge of the board is not a wall, so some areas around the edge might remain unclaimed.

Each claimed scarab is worth +1 point, but each claimed bonfire is worth −3 points (najas don’t like fire!). Ties are possible and are OK: Just play again!

—description from the publisher

Name: You've Got Geeky Problems
Description:
You've got GEEKY problems is an expansion to You've got problems that will give you all kinds of new geeky perks and problems. Would you rather have your body controlled by a button masher, or be stuck in The Upside Down? These choices won’t be easy, but at least you’ll suffer while being able to say “I GET THIS REFERENCE!”

—description from the publisher

Name: You've Got Dirty Problems
Description:
You've got DIRTY problems is an expansion to You've got problems that will give you all kinds of new horrible perks and problems. Would you rather have your the President tweet a picture of you naked every day, or have your eyes on your genitals? These choices are going to be disgusting and terrifying. If that’s the kind of thing you’re into, this is the expansion pack for you.

—description from the publisher

Name: Folklore: The Affliction – Adventure Creation Kit
Description: Adventure Creation Kit & Nightmare Adventures (FL23): Create your own stories, creatures, characters, afflictions, maps and much more. Everything you need to turn Folklore into your own sandbox adventure system, plus a total of six full-length stories/adventures. Softcover.

Name: AME: the Corrupted Affliction Pack
Description: A special jumbo-sized crossover affliction from Champions of Hara, featuring cards for both games. Includes a side quest consisting of an Off-road event and Rumor cards, as well as her affliction card for Folkore.

Name: Schach-Ballspiel
Description:
Each player has 11 playing pieces. The pieces may capture each other. Different pieces move and capture differently:

Center-Forward (1x): moves straigt or diagonal, captures any adjacent piece
Outside-Forward (4x): moves 1 space diagonal + any spaces straight, captures any diagonal adjacent piece
Midfielder (3x): moves diagonal, captures any diagonal adjacent piece
Defensive players (2x): moves straight or diagonal, captures any adjacent piece
Goalkeeper (1x): moves to any of the 5 spaces in front of the goal, may not capture and can't be captured

If a playing piece enters a space adjacent to the ball, it may play the ball straight ahead, as many spaces as possible or wanted. If the ball ends it's move adjacent to another playing piece it may be played further according to it's movement ability and so on.

The first player to achieve a goal wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Rabbit Gene Rummy
Description:
The bunny-themed card game that helps teach the basic principles of Mendelian inheritance. We’ve all heard the idiom: “breeding like rabbits”. Well, here is a card game that brings it to life! No smell, no fuss, no need for cages! Here’s a visual way to learn the jargon and the basic principles of Mendelian inheritance while playing a fast-paced card game.

Create legal matings by matching a buck (dad) and doe (mom) with one baby they could 'legally' produce according Mendel's Laws. Earn points for each known allele that appears in a mating. The more unknown alleles you can fill in for each mating, the more points you can earn.

Brief Overview of Gameplay:

     Cards are dealt to each player with some left over to go on the table as the Gene Pool (draw pile).
     On each turn you draw a card. 
     If you can form a legal mating, you lay the trio down. 
     Then discard one card if you have one. 
     The game ends when someone runs out of cards or both draw piles are depleted (the Gene Pool and Retirement). 
     The winner is the person with the most points.


—description from the designer

Name: Warpath Firefight
Description:
Firefight is a medium-scale skirmish wargame set in the same exciting universe of Warpath. It goes deeper into the action, zooming in and allowing you to decide the fate of your soldiers in smaller conflicts. The game focuses on squad-based action and individual soldiers, where the stakes are desperate and every bullet counts.
Firefight uses the Warpath miniatures range and shares some core mechanics, however the gameplay is more focused on the fate of individual units to ensure you have a totally different sci-fi gaming experience.
 This rulebook contains everything you need to know to play Firefight’s strategic skirmishes. Inside you will find:


     a new take on the Warpath rules, presenting a new challenge with a familiar starting point.
     detail-oriented mechanics to make every soldier count.
     comprehensive terrain rules that tie in with Mantic’s Battlezones scenery range.
     customizable character equipment to make your unit leaders stand out.


—description from the publisher

Name: A Game of Knights and Knaves: Fire and Ice Expansion
Description:
This is an Expansion for A Game of Knights and Knaves which allows you to recreate both Historical and Fantistorical battles and campaigns set in the medieval period.  You can create an army from your favourite fantasy book, television series or movie or, if you, prefer from history.  A campaign system lets you and your friends take the command of a great house and battle for the throne of mythical or historical England in the kingdoms.  This Expansion includes The Battle for the Throne campaign system and complete orders of battles for a campaigns set in mythical Westerlands, England during the War of the Roses and an alternative history campaign featuring exiled Lancastrians, Spanish Conquistadors, the Aztec Empire, a Native American Confederation and a Viking Colony all battling for control of the New World.

-description from publisher's website

Name: A Game of Knights and Knaves: The Olde World Expansion
Description:
A Game of Knights and Knaves allows you to recreate both Historical and Fantistorical battles and campaigns set in the medieval period.  This Expansion lets you create armies from medieval Europe both mythical and historical.  A campaign system lets you and your friends take the command of a great house and battle for the throne of fantasy Olde World or historical Europe in the Hundred Years War.

You need a copy of the A Game of Knights and Knaves – the Basic Game to use this Expansion.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Neue Kohle
Description:
By skillfully playing the euro notes, it is important to win the largest amount of money.
Depending on your mood, you can choose between three game variants, each requiring different decisions. Combine these three variants with each other, so you have up to seven game variants - up to the championship.
Of the 14 different Euro banknotes, each of which must be operated differently, you only have a maximum of five in your hand to play it profitably.

Name: Normandy 1944
Description:
This is a card-driven game on the 1944 Normandy landing. Basically, the system is the same as Manstein's Trump: The Third Battle of Kharkov.

Components:

    120 pieces (15 mm)
    1 map (A2 size)
    4 card sheets
    One rule book (12 pages in Japanese) 


--

Issue game in Command Magazine Japan #141

Name: Queen's Quest
Description:
The most authentic roguelike available on the tabletop!

Long ago, the Known Lands were invaded by the Gone, a savage army of undead warriors. The War lasted for centuries, and the invaders were only defeated through the use of the Relic, a weapon of unimaginable, world-shattering power. After the War was won, the Relic was stored deep in King Boldfoot’s vaults, and the Known Lands enjoyed a long period of peace and prosperity.

Everything changed when the Gone returned and stole the Relic. To assure their own survival, the Gone broke the Relic into four parts and hid its pieces in the Known Lands’ deepest and most forbidding places. Brave adventurers, you must retrieve the shards of the Relic. The fate of our world is on your shoulders.

Queen’s Quest is a cooperative, dungeon-crawling adventure for 1-5 players. Inspired by classic “Roguelike” computer games, Queen’s Quest features random map generation, 396 different character combinations, 360 different types of standard monsters, multiple levels of difficulty, and secret, “unlockable” content. Each level of the dungeon takes under one hour to play.

Do you enter the dungeon (Y/N)?_

Name: Farmito
Description:
Farmito introduces children to the joys of country life. By pairing baby animals with their parents, leading them to their living quarters, feeding them and collecting their produce, they learn how a traditional farm works and how important wild animals are in preserving the balance of nature. (Information from the publisher).

A game for smaller children.

You roll a die:

     if it shows "animals" you flip an animal counter and try to match the animal to the corresponding Living area of the farm
     if it shows "feed" you pick the first feed marker from a pile and place it to the corresponding living area of the farm (where the animals live that eat this)
     if it shows the "farmer" you move the farmer pawn. If there are already 3 animals (mother, Father, kid) in the area and enough Food, the player wins the "produce" counter (e.g. milk from the cows or eggs from the chicken).


When the Five products have been picked up the game ends. The player who has collected the most produce counters wins the game.

—user summary

Name: XO
Description:
XO is a tactical, abstract game of spacial reasoning, pattern recognition and action management for 2 players. The winner will be the player that most cleverly manipulates the field of characters to score the most points.

—description from the designer

Name: Daggers High
Description:
In Daggers High, you play an overworked high school student who will do anything to get into the best university in the nation. Unfortunately, only one student will be accepted. Manage your grades, social life, and influence with teachers to gain resume points. The player with the most resume points at the end of the game wins!

Players begin the game with 4 Freshman event cards, and draft them. In a two-player game, the players will draw 6 Freshman event cards and discard 2 of them. Then, the players take turns playing cards from their hand. The card's event occurs. Then, the player gains a number of action points. Each action point can be spent on one of the five actions. Players can socialize to gain friends that can be used to purchase club leadership, granting an immediate and yearly bonus as well as Resume Points. Players can also study to gain one of four stats that can go towards test correcting a class, another action. Correcting a class to an A provides a teacher influence bonus as well as resume points. A player can also chat with one of eight teachers to gain teacher influence with them. This influence can be spent on a special ability or on gaining a recommendation letter that is worth a significant amount of Resume Points. Finally, players can relax to reduce their stress. This is important because a high amount of stress will cause breakdown, resulting in lower happiness that increases stress at the end of every year, and a detention that causes a loss of Resume Points.

Players also manage secret goals in the form of Essays. Each player is dealt two Essays at the beginning of the game, and can complete them at any time to draw an additional essay. All essays are worth points at the end of the game. At the start of Junior Year, players may also elect to take the FUN, a standardized test that costs Stats to take. The FUN result is determined by a die roll, and can result in a large resume point bonus, or nothing at all.

-description from designer

Name: D'Lerium
Description: In this game you roll the custom dice to see which gestures to do, and the player who is slowest gets stamped (a rubber stamp is included in the game). You lose the game when you have three stamps.

Name: Battle for Russia: Operation Barbarossa, June – December 1941
Description:
Issue game in Command Magazine Japan #134

Battle for Russia (BfD) is a two-player, low-intermediate complexity, strategic-level simulation of the first six months of World War II’s eastern front in Europe. The game presents a unique interpretation of the campaign in that the two German commanders are also simultaneously Soviet commanders. The player who runs the “German Northern Command” also runs the “Soviet Sothern Command,” and the player who runs the “German Southern Command” also runs the “Soviet Northern Command.”

In that way both players – when in their roles as German field marshals – are trying to win the game by using their own forces to outdo the competing German player. What matters most is not defeating the Soviets, but accomplishing more than your counterpart German field marshal. In that way you will earn the lion’s share of the credit from the Fuehrer. Of course, since you also command the Soviet forces resisting the advance of your counterpart German field marshal’s advance, those Red Army units are also helping you to win by frustrating him.

Name: Sherlock & Picasso
Description:
What can be easier than drawing a ladder or a Christmas tree? A few lines on a piece of paper will be enough. But what if another person will come and turn your sketch into something completely different? And right in front of your eyes, the ladder turns into tracks with a train at full speed, and the Christmas tree becomes a toothy monster...

Each round in Sherlock & Picasso, there is a pairing of the artist and the rascal. The first has 40 seconds to sketch up to eight objects, and the second then spoils each picture, so other players can't guess the initial object. If they do, they and the artist gain victory points; if they don't, the rascal has managed to fool them and gets points for that!

—description from the publisher

Name: Cul de Chouette
Description:
Cul de Chouette is a dice game originated from the French comedy series Kaamelott.

The winner is the first player to reach 343 points (343 = CDC, the initials of the game).

The rule are deliberately complicated, with different rules to add to make it more or less difficult.

The player throws two dice, then the last die, and sees his result. Other player may interact, be the first to shout a peculiar sentence in order to win points or not to lose them, bet another player points to do a specific result...

Any mistake makes you lose 10 points.

—user summary

Name: Carcassonne: Spiel Doch Mini Expansion
Description:
Issue 2/2018 (autumn/winter 2018) of the german boardgame magazine SPIEL DOCH! published in september 2018.

As usual, the magazine offers a lot of content for all game fans and everyone starting to discover this hobby. Two new tiles, one with a donkey stable and one with a garden for the Abbott, for the original Carcassonne are included in this issue; you can use them to play the variant where the player who manages to place the two new tiles in the correct order immediately receives five extra points.

Two additional tiles for the brand new Carcassonne Safari show an elephant/lion and a zebra/giraffe.

Name: Anime Island
Description:
Welcome to the Network's newest hit reality survival game show... Anime Island!
We've taken 16 cliche anime characters and stuck them on an island together.  They'll face new challenges each episode.  They'll fall in love, become rivals, and entertain you every step of the way.  One-by-one they will be voted of by you, the viewers, in a process called, The Tribunal!  Call in your votes now to make sure your favorite characters survive... Anime Island!

Players have secret agendas dictating which characters they want to stay and which ones they want to go.  For instance an agenda may say if you get both Cookie and Jikurou kicked off the island you get 10 points.  Another could say if you make sure Daphne stays on the show the whole game, you'll get 11 points. Each episode (round) the characters face a challenge which will change which characters fall in love, become rivals, or are immune to the tribunal vote.

Use deduction and negotiation, along with special tribunal powers of the fallen characters, player will try to manipulate the game to score the most from their secret agendas.

The Game takes place over several rounds (episodes).
Each episode has the following phases:
1) Today's Challenge
Challenge cards are flipped up and determine which characters become rivals, form partnerships, or have immunity.
2) The Discussion
A 1-minute sand timer is flipped and everyone discuses who to vote off of the island.  Characters that gained immunity during the challenge cannot be voted for.
3) The Tribunal Vote
When the timer runs out every player simultaneously points to a character (that does not have immunity).
The character with the most votes is kicked off the island.  In a tie> They are each kicked off!
Any character that is partnered with a character that is voted off, also gets kicked off the island.  A Character that is a rival with a character that gets kicked off the island gains immunity for the next episode (in addition to whoever gets immunity through the challenge)

After 9 episodes, the game ends, and players calculate their score based on their secret agendas and which characters got kicked off, and which ones remain.

Name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Sickbay Ressource
Description:
The Sickbay Resource is a participation prize given to players who participated in the Turret Turmoil Organized Play Event. It is considered a Resource and costs 6 squadron points.

It can only be equipped to a ship with a hull value greater than 3, and allows the player to either place 2 time tokens on this ship's admiral, captain or crew when they would otherwise be disabled, or discard Sickbay when one of those cards would be discarded.

Name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Kal-If-Fee
Description:
Kal-If-Fee is a prize given to players who won in the Turret Turmoil Organized Play Event.

The card is a talent, that allows the owner to target a crew on an enemy ship and has to target one on the ship this card is equipped to. Both players must roll attack dice, the one who rolls more hits and crits must discard the crew. The card has to be disabled to use the action of this card.

Name: Masterminds & Minions
Description:
Play as a cliché villainous mastermind trying to prove that you are the best mastermind!  Choose a secret lair to operate out of, will you choose the abandoned nuclear launch silo, perhaps the orbital space platform, or do you find yourself still operating out of your mom’s basement?

Players will use their mastermind to create minions and send them out to the cities to pull off heists.  Unfortunately for your unsuspecting minions, those cities are guarded by super heroes and security forces.  Those forces that keep villains like you from doing all the fun things villains do, will make life for your hapless minions...unpleasant.

Complete heists and upgrade your secret lair to prove that you are a better mastermind than the rest.

A variety of masterminds, cities, and lairs to choose from coupled with unique gameplay for each mastermind ensures that Masterminds & Minions will remain fun time and time again.

When the game begins four cities will be selected for the board, each city is protected by a custom super hero.  Each player will choose one mastermind and one secret lair.  Each mastermind has a custom deck of cards, and additionally will draw three heist and city cards to determine their evil plans and where they will try to accomplish them.  Action points can be spent to play mastermind cards, use lair abilities, or take other game actions.  This will allow the players to create minion cubes and move them from the mastermind’s lair out to the various cities that have been selected for this game.  Once the minions are in the city, each player turn a super hero card will be played trigging the security forces and super hero’s powers.  When enough cubes have been accumulated a heist can be completed scoring victory points for the mastermind.

Players will also have other special cards or abilities custom to each mastermind and lair that will allow them to interact with the game and other players in interesting ways.

In addition to completing heists, victory points are accumulated by upgrading your lair to make it cooler than the other mastermind’s lairs.  Once enough victory points are scored a winner is declared.

-description from designer

Name: Midnight Legion: Portal of Life
Description:
Portal of Life is the final gamebook in the Midnight Legion trilogy. However, it can be played as a stand alone or following book 2, The World Reborn, and book 1, Operation Deep Sleep.

The Midnight Legion: Portal of Life is an interactive story where you decide what happens next. Solve puzzles, recover lost memories, and utilize combat, stealth, or sixth sense and diplomacy. It is a highly advanced, color illustrated gamebook   with  control over your character and world. An interactive story is combined with combat, strategy, puzzles, diplomacy, stealth and role playing elements. Collect information, knowledge, and goods from the world around you to advance your character.

The world that has replaced it is alien and savage, but filled with wondrous new life. In the last remaining Midnight Legion base a computer controls technology that can destroy it or help it to thrive. If you’re strong enough you can defeat the agent who betrayed your mission. If you’re clever and skilled enough you can solve the base’s puzzles and outwit its traps. But even then you will still need to confront the sentient, possibly deranged computer itself. What it can tell you depends on how much you are willing to sacrifice to regain the memories you have lost.

Name: Brige: The Board Game
Description:
A political game where a player plays as a party in a town called Brige in Europe, 1915. His goal is to attract as many followers to support his party by moving across the map of Brige. The game begins with the overthrow of Major of Brige, and ends in 1918, the end of WW2, when order is brought back to the town and elections take place. The party with the most voters wins the game.

The game is consisted of a main board map (the town of Brige), Personal Board- these boards give information about the party's current stand. Their content is changed along the game as the party is influenced by the player's decisions, and other effects . In addition, there are "Point of Interest" cards that resemble an encounter with a citizen or an event that is happening that requires the party's decision. Whenever a player lands on a Point of Interest, he takes a card from the pile and must act according to the type of event at hand, and organize his position after reading the consequences. The face of the cards is where the information about the event is given, with the available decisions & options at its bottom. On the back of the card is where the decision's effect is shown.

Along the game, a party may hire citizens that it encounters and turn them into "Agents". Once this is done, the player places a figure on the board. Agents are the connecting bridge between the players, and allows a party to make contact with other parties. Every agent has its own skill and have specific actions that can be done with them. A Gunman for example, may attack other units on the board, including the party leader that will lose the player's game if is assasinated.

An important aspect in the game is money. The game currency is called "Brigs", and is affected by the current information on the player's Personal Board, or throught drawn Point of Interest cards. Without money, an agent can't be paid, some actions can't be made, and the player will most likely have few units on the board, what makes him vulnerable to Gunmans. The player must carefuly plan his campaign in order to make sure he doesn't fall into issues such as this.

—description from the designer

Name: Zombie A Social Club
Description:
Zombie Apocalypse! Punks, Hippies, Survivalists and Capitalists clash and try to impose their vision of the new world order.

Choose your side and pull your pin out of the game to impose yourself on the table.

Your goal will be to be the first to accumulate 7 victory points.

To earn trophies you will have to attack the other players, slaughter the zombies that have invaded the city center (in the middle of the table), and / or have managed to attract VIP survivors to your side.

Survivor cards in your camp can do actions to interact on the table: search, attack, or rally other survivors to your cause. But beware, the bigger your camp, the more likely you are to attract the Horde of Zombies!

It's your turn…

Name: The Bible
Description: Bible trivia game based on the TV miniseries "The Bible"

Name: Orang Rimba: The Forest Keeper
Description:
Orang Rimba or Anak Dalam tribe is a native resident of Bukit Dua Belas National Park in Jambi. They live harmoniously with nature that provides them resources to live and survive. However, the peace is suddenly broken. Some parts of the forests are massively exploited by irresponsible people, leaving nature prone to destruction and lost of many resources.

In Orang Rimba: The Forest Keeper, players represent two members of the Orang Rimba tribe. Each turn, they spend action points to move around the forest gathering resources, complete a goal, deliver goods to barter for other goods, and chase away the illegal loggers who irresponsibly exploit the forest resources for their own benefit.

The game ends after twelve rounds or when one of the players has managed to complete all of their goals.

Name: Magic Maze: Hidden Roles
Description:
Magic Maze: Hidden Roles presents a new challenge when your group of adventurers is trying to grab the right items and exit the maze. Turns out that one or more of you might not actually be interested in leaving. Yes, you have a traitor in your midst, someone who is trying to thwart the team from exiting — but if they get called out during the game, then someone else gets to claim their action and take charge of it, so they'll need to be sneaky in order to keep the clock running and let the team fail.

Hidden Roles also includes challenge cards that players might acquire before or during play: visit this location, claim that object. Can you make others help you achieve your hidden goal?

Note from publisher: These expansions don't work with fewer than 3 players.

Name: 2018 Malibu Games Because Summer
Description:
2018 Malibu Games Because Summer is a word game consisting of tiles packaged in a pouch that resembles a pineapple. Players form teams. Tiles are drawn from a central pile and used to make words. Some tiles are "twistable" meaning the tile can be used as two different letters depending on which edge is up. Teams can steal other teams tiles by adding tiles to make a word or rearranging the tiles to make another word. When the draw pile is exhausted the game is over and the team with the most used tiles wins.

—user summary

Name: Bugsies
Description:
Bugsies is a fast and easy game for the little ones in which you need to be quick and sharp.

Wooden chips representing butterflies, bees and ladybugs are sitting on the colored petals, and players are holding them by their string tails. The player who holds a wooden spider cup throws the dice, and the hunt begins!

The leader throws the dice in the middle of the flower field and tries to catch the bug that was shown on the dice while the bug is still sitting on the petal. The player that is holding this bug needs to quickly figure out that their bug is about to be caught and straightway pull it away from the petal. The leader throws the dice and tries to catch the right bug until they succeed. When the spider, finally, gets the bug, the player whose bug was caught passes the string tail to the leader and takes the spider cup to become the leader in the next round.

The game has three rule options, three different levels of difficulty. You can throw one die with colors and hunt for those who sit on the petal of the given color. It's a little harder to react to the die with the colors and shapes of the bugs. And for the advanced Bugsies, there is an option with two dice. Here the task is to combine given colors and shapes.

The game ends when... in fact, it doesn't have to end. You can take a break when everyone has played enough and every player got a chance to be a spider. Thank each other for the great game, rest a little, and come back to Bugsies.

Name: Links
Description: In Links we will have fun finding the word that unites two or more characteristic cards and we can do it in 7 different ways. Depending on the number of players, of time available and why not, of our mood, we could choose different challenges and different ways of create "links" by exclaiming the right word at the right time!

Name: Suomalainen Pesis taktiikkapeli
Description:
Suomalainen Pesis taktiikkapeli (translates as: Finnish Baseball tactical game) came out in 1977. This two player game "simulates" Finnish national sport Pesäpallo (Baseball) which was developed in 1910's from American Baseball and old Finnish ball and bat sport called Kuningaspallo (King Ball).

This boardgame is a two player game and uses card based "rock-paper-scissors" -system to simulate the various situations and decisions in the field. Player of Fielding team and player of Batting team have their own cards to choose. The cards (usually three different) player can use depend on the situation on the field (ie. how many runners are on the field etc.).

Depending which action (card) batting team player chooses and which one fielding team player chooses determines the outcome of that particular throw of the ball. Both cards are revealed simultaneously. Batting player might have get called "out" or the players on the field might have been called "out" or batting player succeeded to advance from base to another or even managed to score a run.

—user summary

Rules stipulate that the game can be played by either two players or two teams of players, but since the tasks of individual team members are not defined any further than that in the rules, this is essentially just a 2-player game.

Box front carries an endorsement by the then executive director of the Finnish Baseball League, Markku Pullinen.

Patent pending no. 772736

Name: Hancúr Párbaj
Description:
A game for adults and only for adults! 18+

Expand your sex life with a little adventure.

You need to go through three zones called attraction, desire and sex. In every zone you need to draw a card, which contains something kindness for your partner. For example backrub or some gently touches.

As you are going trough the zones the cards will become more serious, and in the last sex zone the cards contain poses about... I think we all know what I am talking about it :)

If you reach the finish line before your partner, you will win, but be carefull, the one who reach the orgasm before the finish line, will lose the game.

Name: Dirty Habits
Description: Collect six category tokens (Partners, Eating, Work, Bathroom, Shopping, and Travelling) by answering correctly, truthfully or to the satisfaction of all the other players a question in the appropriate category. Tokens can be lost by declining to perform or describe a named nasty habit. Questions are of the kind of "How would you disguise that you were eating your earwax?"

Name: Stone Age: Anniversary
Description:
The "Stone Age" times were hard indeed. In their roles as hunters, collectors, farmers, and tool makers, our ancestors worked with their legs and backs straining against wooden plows in the stony earth. Of course, progress did not stop with the wooden plow. People always searched for better tools and more productive plants to make their work more effective.

In Stone Age, the players live in this time, just as our ancestors did. They collect wood, break stone and wash their gold from the river. They trade freely, expand their village and so achieve new levels of civilization. With a balance of luck and planning, the players compete for food in this pre-historic time.

Players use up to ten tribe members each in three phases. In the first phase, players place their men in regions of the board that they think will benefit them, including the hunt, the trading center, or the quarry. In the second phase, the starting player activates each of his staffed areas in whatever sequence he chooses, followed in turn by the other players. In the third phase, players must have enough food available to feed their populations, or they face losing resources or points.

Stone Age: 10th Anniversary is a new edition of the Stone Age base game that features a double-sided game board (winter and summer), decorative player pieces, a revised rulebook, two mini-expansions ("The Igloos" and "The Wild Animals"), and a "Winter Is Hard!" variant.

Name: Seanchaí
Description:
Seanchaí (bearer of old lore in Gaelic) is a matching/capture card game based on the myths and lore of Ireland.  There are seven regular suits (Warfare, Legends, Landscape, Treasure, Roles, Religion, Stoneworks) which are captured by matching cards of the same suit.  There are two special suits:  Shamrocks and Dark Cards.  Shamrocks are free points and extend a turn.  Dark cards are discards against another player.

Each turn consists of an action followed by a discard.  The action can be either capturing a same suited card on the Tableau with a card in a player’s hand or flipping over a card.  The flipped card is now the only card that can capture: either a card from the player’s hand or one from the Tableau.  Captured cards are moved to a player’s point field.  A discard ends the turn which is either a regular suited card on the tableau or a dark card against another player.

Complexity and strategy is created by determining when to play Shamrocks to extend a turn, when to capture cards that can be effected by Dark cards, saving wild cards or other counter cards to combat a dark card, and strategizing to capture the cards that are part of a scéal (story).   
 The goal of the game is to amass the highest points after four rounds.  Points are counted on individual cards as well as in combinations of scéalta (stories) that are depicted by matching icons.  Dark cards are negative points and have special effects that can target other cards.  Any cards left in a player’s hand at the end of a round are counted against them.

—description from the publisher

Name: Skylands: Queenie 1
Description: Skylands: Queenie 1 is a mini-expansion for Skylands that adds four long special island fragments and four special islands with no effect to the game.

Name: Skylands: Queenie 2
Description: Skylands: Queenie 2 is a mini-expansion for Skylands that adds four special island tiles with one shot effects and four special island tiles with ongoing effects to the game.

Name: Skylands: Queenie 3
Description: Skylands: Queenie 3 is a mini-expansion for Skylands that adds four special island tiles with scoring effects and four special island tiles with competitive scoring effects to the game.

Name: Skylands: Queenie 4
Description: Skylands: Queenie 4 is a mini-expansion for Skylands that adds six multicolored island tiles to the game.

Name: Skylands: Queenie 5
Description: Skylands: Queenie 5 is a mini-expansion for Skylands that adds six joker island tiles to the game.

Name: Franchise: Queenie 1 – Milestones & Boom
Description: Franchise: Queenie 1 is a mini-expansion for Franchise that adds seven milestone tiles to the base game and the boom token.

Name: Franchise: Queenie 2 – Rewards
Description: Franchise: Queenie 2 is a mini-expansion for Franchise that adds twenty reward tiles and two reward tokens to the base game.

Name: Bastille: Queenie 1
Description: Bastille: Queenie 1 adds eight new Versailles tiles to the Bastille base game to give players new options to further customize their gameplay.

Name: Bastille: Queenie 2
Description:
Bastille: Queenie 2 includes new mid- and endgame scoring tiles that change the conditions for what scores and what is most valuable to collect throughout the game. Players can choose to play with only the new scoring tiles or shuffle them with the tiles from the base game and randomly draw for the game set-up.

Additionally, new round tiles are added to the game that give more variety to the bonus provided for having the most flags.

Name: Bastille: Queenie 3
Description: Bastille: Queenie 3 gives each player one new influence tile numbered 5 to their supply. This tile, once acquired, is very powerful and can gain you a lot of coins or spaces on the bastille track, and it can make convincing people to fight for your cause even cheaper.

Name: Stranded
Description:
Tragedy strikes as your spaceship descends through the planet's atmosphere and crashes on its surface...You have become stranded.

A decision must be made: build a self-sustaining colony or find a way to get a strange alien ship working again.

In Stranded, you score victory points by constructing colony buildings and by investigating the alien ship. But, in addition to competing for access to best building and newly discovered technologies, you must negotiate how you will work together with other players to complete the colony or escape via the alien ship.

Each turn players take a number of actions with their explorers cubes depending on the cards they play. These actions can include: Claiming a part of the colony, which requires a set number of explorers, or claiming an alien technology for which you use your explorer to 'outbid' other players. Colony buildings and ship technologies when claimed are added to your hand of cards, thus increasing your ability to take additional actions in future turns.

Colony building and actions that repair the alien ship can be done collaboratively--and players can negotiate the completion of a specific building or the repair of a part of the ship to their advantage.

The game ends when either the colony is completed or the ship is fully repaired. Since players are awarded extra points for correctly forecasting which outcome ends the game, ad hoc alliances are formed as players seek to steer the game to their chosen conclusion.

—description from the designer

Name: Kongkang
Description:
End fast, but the grudge will last long!

Kongkang is a party card game based on a traditional card game from Southern Thailand called "Kang". Players try to get rid of high cards and match those previously played to steal Banana tokens. When someone declares "Kongkang", everyone reveals their hand, and the player who has the lowest hand wins the pot. After three rounds, the player with the most banana tokens wins!

At the beginning of the first round, deal 5 cards to each player. Everyone places 2 Banana tokens in the center of the table as a pot for the round. On your turn, you must perform one of the following actions:

     Draw a card and play any number of identical cards. If they are special cards, resolve the action for each card.
     Follow the card(s) played by the previous player. First, play any number of cards that match the followed card(s). Then, steal that many Banana tokens from that player. However, if that player also followed the previous player, instead steal from the player who first played the card(s).
     Declare Kongkang. Everyone reveals all cards in their hand and compute their total value (with special card being worth 10). The player with the lowest total wins the round and claims all Banana tokens from the pot, where a tie goes to the one closest to (and including) the declarer in turn order. In addition, if the declarer didn't win, they discard half the Banana tokens to the game box.


When a player draws the last card from the deck, the next player is forced to declare Kongkang. After the winner is determined, a new round begins with these changes.

     The winner of the round becomes the first player for the next round. 
     Players with the most Banana tokens place 4 tokens in the pot, and those with the fewest Banana tokens place 1 token. Everyone else places 2 tokens as usual.

Name: Wendake: Promo Tiles 2018
Description:
Wendake: Promo Tiles 2018 is a set of four tiles for Wendake. The tiles are:

				
				
					Level 1 Action tiles:
    You can perform 1 action of your choice among the four that allow you to score Victory Points. This tile is never flipped on the ritual side.
    Perform a Canoe action, then redistribute your Canoes on the lakes as you wish, then perform an Alliance action.


				
				
					Level 2 Action tiles:
    Trade 1 Leather for 2 Rifles, then take 1 Turn card from the discard pile. If it shows an Alliance action, you can perform it immediately.
    You can use 3 Level 1 tiles you discarded earlier in the game, in any order you like.


—description from the publisher

Name: Elefantræs
Description:
A memory racing game.
Get your elephant across the meadow to the circus tent by remembering the tiles.

Name: Den hemmelige have
Description: A memory game for two players (or two two-player teams). On their turn, a player will draw a card, look at it, and place it on the board so the opponent can see the the front side of the card. The player will then have to recite all the cards that they have drawn. This will become harder and harder, and once a player fails, the opponent will get a point. First player to five point wins.

Name: ヴァルハラスカウト (Valhalla Scout)
The Holiday Fun Quiz Pack
Description:
Do you know the name for a baby turkey?  Or which US state was the first to declare Christmas a legal holiday? Can you hum the tune to "Frosty the Snowman"? Put your knowledge to the test with this bumper pack of quizzes and games! With one quiz dedicated to all things festive, another with questions on everything from food and drink to geography, and a game that sees you humming the tunes of well-known festive songs for you teammates to guess, this set is the ultimate in holiday fun!

Set contains:
100 holiday quiz questions
100 general knowledge questions
50 holiday "hum that tune" cards

—description from the back of the box

Name: Arkantar
Description:
The chivalrous strategy game!

By turning over the tiles, each player builds or destroys Walls, creating rather ramparts that protect their pawns, or Paths that allow their movement and the capture of the adversary's pawn.

There are 3 possible types of actions :

     build a Wall
     destroy a Wall
     move a pawn


During his turn, a player can decide to do 1, 2, or 3 actions. The same type of action can be repeated.

The player who captures the opponent's Queen/King is the winner.

—description from the designer

Name: Resident Evil 7 (fan expansion for T.I.M.E. Stories)
Description:
Cross over into the Resident Evil universe with this new fan expansion!

One of our best T.I.M.E. insertion teams has gone dark. Its fallen onto you to take a team back to the year 2017, find the missing agents, find out what is preventing them from reintegrating with the caisson transference, and then bring them back home safely. And if still active, prevent the trafficking of illegal bio-weapon material into the present day.

Theme: Screen captures from the Resident Evil 7 video game. Does not follow game story.
Game Length: Same amount of locations as Asylum, but takes longer due to larger locations.
Difficulty: Easy to Average

—description from the designer

Print 4 cards per page, double-sided.

Name: Last Full Measure: The Battles of Cross Keys and Port Republic
Description:
Fremont and McDowell are closing in to destroy Jackson's army at Port Republic.

Last Full Measure: Cross Keys and Port Republic is a free print-and-play game of the battles in the Shanandoah Valley just south of Massanutten Mountain, June 8th-9th, 1862, the sixth game in the LFM series.

A brigade scale game that uses regiment counters, as opposed to generic line markers, to spread the brigade over multiple hexes according to it's size. Ranged artillery fire, cavalry charges, command and control, all in only eight pages of rules. Play aids include Player-aid card with CRT and other charts and table; Eliminated Units card, Order of Arrival card, and 254 2-sided counters.

This map measures 30" x 34" at a scale of 250 yard per 3/4" hex.

-description from designer

Name: Intelle: Firewall
Description:
An expansion to the game Intelle that allows players to play solo. The expansion adds a deck of cards, firewall cubes and an additional meeple, and all will fit in the original box! Solo play time is under 10 minutes.

—description from the designer

Name: The Monster Among Us
Description:
The Monster Among Us is a social deduction/hidden role game played over three nights.  You and your friends reside in a quiet village.  But lately, things haven’t been so quiet.  A series of killings, always at night, has plagued your village. And one thing is clear: these attacks are not the work of mere men.  A monster is behind them; but what kind?

A team of 4 to 9 villagers, each with unique skills and occupations, must band together to search the village and its surroundings in pursuit of the hidden monster. But there’s a problem. It is becoming increasingly clear that some of the villagers are not what they seem. No one can be trusted - not even you - because the monster is among us.

—description from the designer

Name: Bezzerwizzer Bricks: Fantasy
Description:
Are you not brave enough to mention you-know-who, and do you also participate in the game of thrones? Do you make a "skill check" before you behead the dragon, and do you dream about vampires at new moon? Here is the quiz for everyone that knows the way to Mordor.

This game contains 60 questions, in addition to a category tile, that can be used as a standalone game, or to expand your Bezzerwizzer game with this new category.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Bezzerwizzer Bricks: Svenska språket
Description:
Do you get clammy when other people can't separate "they" and "them", and do you know the antonym to the word "advantage"? Do you yell at the tv when you hear a proverb used incorrectly? Here is the quiz for us who is not "born behind a wagon".

This game contains 60 questions, in addition to a category tile, that can be used as a standalone game, or to expand your Bezzerwizzer game with this new category.

Name: Kush
Description:
North Africa 1,800 BCE

The peoples in the kingdom of Kush intermingled while vying for power and influence and calling on the spirits of the dead for help.

Fast moving, tile-stacking game with many twists, which pulls you into the transcendental spiritual realm.

SET TO PLAY

Each player receives people tiles in their player color. Players take turns placing their tiles on any open square on the 8 x 8 board.

PLAY

Players take turns to move any tile or an entire stack of tiles to any adjacent square, on top of any other tile or stack. Tiles cannot be moved off of a stack or onto an open square.

With everyone being able to move anyone else’s tiles, or alternative play where you cannot move your own tiles, loose co-operation and negotiation are key.

END OF PLAY

The game is over when there are no more moves. The winner has the most tiles visible, either as single tiles or on top of a stack. The player with the highest stack wins a draw.

SPIRITUAL REALM EXPANSION

SET TO PLAY

Each player receives less tiles and players share the use of 8 spirit and 4 dangerous spirit tiles.

PLAY

This is best played with the alternative play. Players can move any of the spirit tiles. The apple and orchid spirits must always remain visible. When the ice is visible on a stack it can be moved once or twice each turn. When one player moves the apple, or a stack with the apple on top of it, onto one of their own visible tiles THAT PLAYER BECOMES THE SPIRITS and scores the spirit’s points instead of their own color.

END OF PLAY

The spirits are very powerful and score like a player and may beat everybody!

KUSH IS ONLY AVAILABLE AS PART OF THE ANCIENT WORLD MULTI GAME SYSTEM FROM PLAYFORD GAMES.

—description from the publisher

Name: Benefactor
Description:
"Did you receive my last letter? Good. I know that being placed in the high council takes a lot of responsibility. Steering the union into wealth and prosperity without bias or favoritism is not an easy task. That is why they picked you. That is why I picked you. Ensure that certain factions prosper more than the others, without being obvious, and I will make sure your political career is long and illustrious. If not, I can find someone else to assist me. ~Your Benefactor."

Your goal as a high council member is to have seven influence points by doing favors and spotting traitors. Most rounds, the active player moves a shared worker token to an empty trade deal space and players vote to raise both factions. Should be easy, but if your bias is discovered, you'll be exposed and censured. Better to play sub-optimally or spark a scandal or two. Be careful about moving up too quickly: you'll be watched more carefully and have extra administrative duties to distract you from your real work: doing the will of your benefactor.

—description from the publisher

Name: Tholos
Description:
GREECE circa 800 BCE - 400 CE

Greece is covered in darkness. Do you remember the days of light? In your quest to save the city of Sparta, you hear rumors of a powerful oracle at the temple of Apollo in Delphi.

A skillful memory game for young and not so young, with Medusa’s and a dangerous dragon.

Can you remember where matching tiles are hidden on the 8 x 8 square board? Enhance your memory with the power of the oracles matches? Beware! Each time the dragon is found and not matched, it turns the board around, steals your matches and may even win the game.

There is also a TIME SLIDING ALTERNATIVE PLAY.

There are myths and rumors that Pythia mastered the mysterious art of time sliding. She drank the foaming waters that spurted from a chasm in the earth to start her slide through time and banish the darkness. Time sliding is when you experience the same events in a loop over and over again. When you die you slide back in time and start again. The loop can only be broken after success in some great challenge. Otherwise you are doomed to slide for eternity! The secret is to set yourself up for success in the next loop by what you do and remember in the loops before. Many do not believe time sliding exists and that it is possible to successfully escape the slide. Are you bold enough to find out yourself?

Play alone or with as many others as you like. The length of play is timed. Each turn you fail, you replace the tiles so it is easier to remember
the matches. The unmatched tiles and all the tiles you have just collected are placed back onto any open square, before turning them over. Then you start another turn.

There is also a WORLD WIDE EXPANSION.

Pythia was renowned all over the world. Nothing was completely hidden from her sight. Your spatial conception is challenged in this fun experience of your favorite places.

Choose a play area, which may be a room, park, or wherever you want to play. All of the tiles are placed face down, in plain sight, scattered within the defined area of play. Tiles may be on the ground or different objects such as plants may be used to make it interesting to search for the tiles.

Time sliding and the world wide expansion can be played together for a unique experience.

THOLOS IS ONLY AVAILABLE AS PART OF THE ANCIENT WORLD MULTI GAME SYSTEM FROM PLAYFORD GAMES

—description from the designer

Name: Dream Lands
Description:
GREECE 5,000 BCE

The Ancients were masters in telling of stories, dreams, visions and prophesies. Their stories were inspired by mysterious symbols, colors and numbers.

Draw symbol tiles from the bag and use them to create the story you want to tell. A tile can be used more than once, and both sides of the tiles can be used within the same story. Its easy to invent a few fables to amuse your friends.

Enchant your audience and win applause disks. May the best dream win.

Carry a bag of tiles and scoring disks with you where ever you go. You are always ready to play.

DREAMLANDS IS ONLY AVAILABLE AS PART OF THE ANCIENT WORLD MULTI GAME SYSTEM FROM PLAYFORD GAMES

—description from the designer

Name: Melos
Description:
AEGEAN SEA 4,000 BCE

Dark obsidian, a glass-like stone, was mined on the volcanic Greek island of Melos for thousands of years. Obsidian was extremely valuable and used to make razor sharp weapons and farm tools. The nearly lifeless island attracted explorers searching for the valuable rocks containing obsidian. They landed their boats next to the beaches and moved inland, where they mined the rock. They pushed the rocks to the beaches and then into their boats for transport overseas.

Choose your tiles carefully, so that together they overcome the resistance of the rocks and opponents. Push your opponent’s tiles into the sea to drown them. With more than two players, the scheming starts as you resist or not, or let some opponents pass.

Melos is only available as part of the Ancient World Multi Game System.

—description from the designer

Name: Assyrians
Description:
MIDDLE EAST circa 700 BCE

Assyria is preparing for battle against the surrounding nations. A lone prophet, Isaiah, has visions of doom. “See, the Lord is going to lay waste to the earth and devastate it; he will scatter its inhabitants.” Will the nations believe that the Assyrians are coming to destroy their towns and cities? They say to the seers, tell us pleasant things and prophesy illusions.

Each round in this numbers game, threat tiles are selected but concealed. Players draw power tiles and may contribute them to the collective power. When a threat is revealed will their power be enough to overcome it? If so, you score the tiles that you kept.

Has everyone contributed enough to overcome the threat or kept their share of the resources? It’s tempting to make excuses and get away with it. Discover each other’s scheming and bluffing side or their open and co-operative nature.

An ice breaker for many players with fast moving discussions.

—description from the designer

Name: Ziggurats
Description:
UR FERTILE CRESENT circa 2,100 BCE

One block at a time, the Sumerians built wide, flat pyramids, called Ziggurats, in their city of Ur.

Be the first to move your block on top of two of any players’ blocks which are stacked on a foundation block. Stop your opponent’s blocks from moving by stacking on top of them. But watch out! Everyone loses when someone cannot move any of their blocks.

—description from the designer

Name: Tekel
Description:
BABYLON 538 BCE

Followers of the Most High God have been deported and brought to the Babylonian empire. During the reign of King Belshazzar they were threatened and oppressed. As the strife increased, there was no turning back. Farmers were put under the control of citizens, citizens were put under the protection of nobles, and governors ruled the nobles to unite them. On Tekel, the day of judgement, the Most High God will decide who has been found wanting?

Players must unite their people by stacking their people tiles in the right order by the time they reach their opponent’s back row. Choose carefully when to unite them, so not to slow their pace or expose them to oppression.

Tekel is only available as part of the Ancient World Multi Game System.

—description from the publisher

Name: Inuit
Description:
GREENLAND circa 1200 CE

The nomadic Inuit peoples of the Arctic were masters in using kayaks to catch fish. The frozen waters where icebergs drifted past rocky islands, were teeming with Greenland cod, halibut, haddock, and arctic char. They rowed out in search of their favorite fish and a balanced diet of all four sorts of fish.

Push a row of tiles on a 8 x 8 square board to stir the waters, ready to catch shoals of the same sort of fish.  Catch the fish, by removing as many tiles in adjacent groups of the same color as you can.

Who do you dare to let know which is your family’s favorite fish? Could they help you?

—description from the designer

Name: Agros
Description:
Much land in Ancient Greece was mountainous and unsuitable for farming.  Farmers competed to plant and harvest grapes, barley, figs, olives, currants and raisins.

Plant four seed tiles at a time on open adjacent squares and try to complete a line of seed tiles across the board to gain a harvest. When there are few open squares, you can remove some of your opponent’s tiles. It looks simple but as the board fills up it gets more tricky. Maybe you want to let someone get a harvest as they will do the same for you. Informal co-operation when more than two play can get you ahead.

Who will be the first to gain six harvests?

AGROS IS ONLY AVAILABLE AS PART OF THE ANCIENT WORLD MULTI GAME SYSTEM FROM PLAYFORD GAMES

—description from the designer

Name: Railways of the World: Mini Expansions
Description:
Contents: 6 sets of 16 Mini-Expansions (a total of 96 pieces) in the 6 original Railways of the World player colors.

Use these as Hotels, Switch Tracks, Fuel Depots and Mines.

NOTE: This item was initially announced as an accessory, but it also has rules. Depending on the exact version, these were included in print, or available as a download.

Name: König Grummelbart
Description:
King Grumpybeard's birthday is coming. Like every year, he should get his favorite honey cake because then he is happy — but where are the ingredients for the cake? Did the rogue Yardweasel leave them sitting on the steps?

In König Grummelbart, the animals have to jump from level to level to quickly collect all the ingredients. The king must not reach the big ballroom before the cake is ready. The players try to skillfully flick the animals on the steps and find the right ingredients. With a little skill and luck, they'll manage to finish the cake together...

Name: Pfannkuchenparty
Description: There's something going on! Petzi and his friends Pelle, Pingu and Seebär are racing. Even pancakes fly through the air. With your catapults you throw the pancakes across the boat. You meet the given targets skillfully, you are allowed to advance your character. And since Petzi and his friends also need jam for a successful pancake party, jam jars have to be found in between. If you are lucky enough to reveal most of the glasses, you can also draw with your figure.

Name: Forum Trajanum: Essen Promo Cards
Description:
Forum Trajanum: Essen Promo Cards is a promo pack that contains three "Trajan" cards. Forum Trajanum comes with twelve Trajan cards, so this pack provides three extra Trajan cards for more variety and replayability in the game!

To collect this pack of promo cards at SPIEL '18, you needed to find three of the four Romans on patrol in the Messe in Essen. Yes, four Romans in traditional garb were wandering the Messe Halls in Essen, and they were stamping a promotion card.  These promo cards were available at the HUCH! and Stronghold Games booths at SPIEL '18. Once you received three or four stamps, the card could be turned in for this pack of promo cards!

Name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): Spike! Journal #1
Description:
Covering the Chaos Chosen, with a veritable host of brand-new content for Blood Bowl.

Contents include detail and background on one of the most violent and entertaining teams to ever grace the pitch – the Chaos Chosen, rules for adding wizards to any Blood Bowl team, includes using wizards as inducements and spotlight on 3 star players.

—user summary

Name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): Spike! Journal #2
Description:
Covering the Dark Elves, with a veritable host of brand-new content for Blood Bowl.

Contents include details and background on the Dark Elves, one of the most enigmatic and stylish races to ever set foot on the Blood Bowl pitch, an introduction to coaching Dark Elves and spotlight on Star Players.

Name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): Spike! Journal #3
Description:
Guest edited by Glug Glottington, this is the third issue of Spike! Journal. Covering Nurgle teams, with a veritable host of brand-new content for Blood Bowl, this is sure to be a must-have for Chaos coaches... Contained in the 36-page journal:

- Papa Nurgle’s Favoured Players: details and background on those teams dedicated to Nurgle, the most bizarrely cheerful of the Chaos gods. You’ll learn how they play, how they look and how they gleefully spread their rot and filth all over the pitch, with a focus on The Diseased Destroyers, Bile-City Blightkings, The Subterranean Slimeballs, and The Plaguebearers;
- Chat With the Rat: ace Skaven reporter Hackspit ‘the Scribbler’ Quillchewer talks with Bilerot Vomitflesh about being a follower of Nurgle, and asks: just where is the Garden of Nurgle?;
- Star Player Spotlight: – a detailed profile of Bilerot Vomitflesh, who can play for Nurgle and Chaos Chosen teams. Includes his in-game cost, stats and skills, and career ‘highlights’;
- Dirt From the Dugout: Spike! Journal interviews gossip columnist Mindy Piewhistle about the rivalry between the Dark Gods, and learns maybe a little more than they’d like about some insidious locker room shenanigans;
- Nurgle Playbook: an Introduction to coaching Nurgle teams, including an overview of the strengths of their team, advice on tactics, set-ups, and examples of the skills you can give to different positions;
